con:interface.name: Cards APIs
con:interface.con:description:
# Overview Cards APIs provide functionalities to retrieve and manage cards of a customer. For example, submit card application, retrieve card details, statements and application status.
# Version History Version | Release date | Link to documentation --------|--------------|---------------------- 1.0 | March, 2018 | Base version of API 1.0 | Aug, 2018 | Add sort parameter in Retrieve Card Summary
# Authentication Card APIs requires a valid **accessToken** to execute any operations. You can obtain one through the Authorization Steps. For more detailed instructions on requesting an *accessToken*, see **Getting Started** section for more details.
# Pagination Pagination is available on some API.
# Frequently Asked Question Q1: How to activate a card for overseas usage?
Ans: Activate overseas usage by using **/cards/{cardId}/overseasCardActivation** with path parameter cardId
Q2: What is the accessToken to be used in the API headers?
Ans: The accessToken should be the Partner's token and not the Customer's accessToken.
# Known Issues This API has no pending issues at the moment. Want to report a new issue? please help us **here**
# Throttling (Rate Limits) We throttle our APIs by default to ensure maximum performance for all developers.
Below is more details to control API rate limits

con:method.name: POST
con:method.con:description: Submits Application for Principal/Supplementary Card Submit Card Application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Retrieves details of card application given an application identifier Retrieve Card Application Detail

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: blockCard
con:method.con:description: Block a Credit/Debit/Bank card. More than one cards can be blocked in a single request. Block card(s)

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: replaceCard
con:method.con:description: Replace or transfer a Credit/Debit/Bank card. Replace a card

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: unblockCard
con:method.con:description: Unblock a Credit/Debit/Bank card. More than one cards can be unblocked in a single request Unblock card(s)

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardDetails
con:method.con:description: Retrieve card details given a tokenized card identifier. Only Credit/Debit/Bank Cards are returned. Retrieve Card Details

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardStatementDates
con:method.con:description: Return list of statement dates for retrieval of past statements. Retrieve Card Statement Dates

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: cardActivationAdd
con:method.con:description: Activate a new Credit/Debit/Bank card. Activate a card

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: overseasCardActivation
con:method.con:description: Activate Credit/Debit/Bank card for overseas usage Activate a card for overseas usage.

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: permanentActivation
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates if overseas usage is to be activated permanently or temporarily. 'TRUE' -Permanent Activation, 'FALSE'- Non-Permanent Activation.

con:parameter.con:name: startDate
con:parameter.con:description: Activation start date. Format is YYYYMMDD.

con:parameter.con:name: endDate
con:parameter.con:description: Activation end date. Format is YYYYMMDD. This date is mandatory only for Non-Permanent Activation.

con:method.name: overseasCardDeactivation
con:method.con:description: Deactivate Credit/Debit/Bank card for overseas usage. Deactivate a card for overseas usage..

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveCardStatementSummary
con:method.con:description: Return card statement summary for a given card identifier and a statement date. Retrieve Card Statement Summary

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: retrieveUnbilledTransactions
con:method.con:description: Return unbilled transactions for given a card identifier. Retrieve unbilled transactions.

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: applyDebitCard
con:method.con:description: Register for new debit card application Create debit card application

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Retrieves list of card applications belonging to a party Retrieve List of Card Applications

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:method.name: GET
con:method.con:description: Return list of active Credit/Debit/Bank cards for a given party identifier. Retrieve Card Summary

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: sort
con:parameter.con:description: Specify the key for sorting in either ascending(asc) or descending(desc) order. Default is no sorting. Eg. sort=lastPurchaseDate:asc. Only 'lastPurchaseDate' is supported currently.

con:method.name: retrieveEligibleProducts
con:method.con:description: Retrieve the list of eligible card products for on-boarded customer. Retrieve eligible card products

con:parameter.con:name: accept-version
con:parameter.con:description: Specifies the acceptable version of the message set. If not specified, the latest version of the API will be considered. Example: 1.2

con:parameter.con:name: applicationType
con:parameter.con:description:
Application Type
NEWCC=New credit card,
ADDNL=Additional credit card,
NEWEDC=New embossed debit card

con:parameter.con:name: partySegment
con:parameter.con:description:
Indicates party segment, mandatory if isStaff flag is false.
01=Treasures-Private Client,
02=Treasures,
03=Private Banking,
04=Personal Banking
